dt: {bc}a process by which information is exchanged between individuals through a common system of symbols, signs, or behavior

a lack of {wi}communication{/wi} between old and young persons

dt: {bc}a system (as of telephones or computers) for transmitting or exchanging information
{bc}a system of routes for moving troops, supplies, and vehicles
{bc}personnel engaged in communicating {bc}personnel engaged in transmitting or exchanging information

ins.spl: plural in form but singular or plural in construction

dt: {bc}a technique for expressing ideas effectively (as in speech)
{bc}the technology of the transmission of information (as by print or telecommunication)

dt.t: Surprisingly little is known about the {wi}communication{/wi} between the alveolar and terminal bronchiolar surfaces …

quotes.t: Whom else had she to open her heart to? If she did not need counsel, she must need the comfort of {qword}communication{/qword}.
This is a secret and confidential {qword}communication{/qword} which I am trusting you to answer on the sly.
If the book is good and even if one is reading to oneself, what is happening is a very special sort of social event, a {qword}communication{/qword} between writer and reader …
It's not an oral {qword}communication{/qword}. It's body language, eye contact, the grinning, the little signals that go on between people.
You don't talk to him, he talks at you. You scream and shout at each other, but there's no {qword}communication{/qword}.
{qword}Communication{/qword} between children in the class was not prohibited but was afforded time slots …

shortdef: a process by which information is exchanged between individuals through a common system of symbols, signs, or behavior; also : exchange of information
information communicated : information transmitted or conveyed
